title: Classic Light Wash Denim Jacket
description: A timeless light wash denim jacket designed with a relaxed fit and button-front closure. Features chest flap pockets and subtle fading for a casual, everyday layered look.
extraInfo: Material: 100% Cotton Denim. Machine wash cold. Regular fit. Ideal for layering.

title: Charcoal Boxy T-Shirt with Roll Sleeve
description: Soft cotton-blend t-shirt in a modern boxy silhouette with rolled sleeves. Designed for a relaxed street-style look.
extraInfo: Material: 95% Cotton, 5% Elastane. Breathable fabric. Relaxed boxy fit.

title: White Graphic Boxy Tee
description: Minimal white t-shirt featuring subtle graphic detail and a trendy boxy cut. Perfect for casual everyday outfits.
extraInfo: Material: 100% Cotton. Soft-touch finish. Loose boxy silhouette.

title: Slim Fit White Button-Up Shirt
description: Crisp white button-up shirt tailored in a slim fit design. A versatile wardrobe essential suitable for both smart and casual wear.
extraInfo: Material: Cotton blend. Slim fit. Lightweight and breathable.

title: Grey Tapered Jogger Pants
description: Comfortable grey joggers with an adjustable drawstring waist and tapered leg design. Ideal for relaxed everyday styling.
extraInfo: Material: Cotton-poly blend. Elastic waistband. Slim tapered fit.

title: Cropped Blue Denim Jacket
description: Modern cropped denim jacket featuring structured seams and a flattering fit. Adds a bold layered touch to any outfit.
extraInfo: Material: 100% Cotton Denim. Cropped length. Button-front closure.

title: Light Wash Distressed Skinny Jeans
description: Mid-rise skinny jeans in a light wash with distressed detailing. Designed for comfort with a flattering stretch fit.
extraInfo: Material: 98% Cotton, 2% Elastane. Zip fly closure. Skinny fit.

title: Classic White Everyday T-Shirt
description: Clean and simple white t-shirt made from soft breathable fabric. A must-have essential for layering or standalone wear.
extraInfo: Material: 100% Cotton. Regular fit. Lightweight and comfortable.
